intro: Callicarpa cubensis, commonly known as the Cuban beautyberry, is a deciduous shrub native to Cuba. It is characterized by its clusters of small, bright red berries that appear in the fall. The plant belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and small trees. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture with a slight pubescence. The berries are not only ornamental but also serve as a food source for various bird species.
